SARVAJANIK UNIVERSITY: B.Sc. CHEMISTRY\r\rProgram: B.Sc. (Sem-VI)Type: Theory\rSubject: DSC-11-Organic Chemistry-4: Study of Spectral Techniques and Industrial Products\rCredit: : 04 (T) + 02 (P)Total learning hours: 60\rCourse description: This course will give an introduction to modern spectroscopic techniques including\rUV, IR, NMR. It also includes insights of photochemistry, pericyclic reaction and supramolecular\rchemistry.\rStudent learning outcome:  Student will learn following :\r•\rUV – Visible, IR, NMR Spectroscopy\r•\rSupramolecular chemistry, Photo Chemistry\r•\rPericyclic reactions(PCR)\r•\rDrug and synthetic dyes\r•\rOrganic Ploymers\r\rUnit-1    UV - Visible Spectroscopy(04 Hrs)\r1.1    Introduction\r1.2    Chromophores and auxochromes\r1.3    Blue shift and red shift\r1.4    Graphical representation of spectra of 1,3-butadiene, benzene and lycopene\r1.5    Influence of conjugation on UV absorption\r1.6    Comparison of UV spectra of acetone and methyl vinyl ketone\rUnit-2   IR Spectroscopy(08 Hrs)\r2.1    Introduction\r2.2    Fundamental and non fundamental molecular vibrations\r2.3    IR absorption position of O,N and S containing functional group\r2.4    Effect of H-bonding, conjugation, resonance, and ring size on IR absorptions\r2.5    Fingerprint region and its significance\r2.6    Application in functional group analysis\r2.7    Stretching frequencies of –OH (free and –H bonded), alkyl – C-H,  C≡C, C=C, C-C,C=O\rand C-O groups\r2.8    Graphical representation of IR spectra of benzoic acid and methyl benzoate\rUnit-3    NMR Spectroscopy(08 Hrs)\r3.1\rBasic principle of proton magnetic resonance\r3.2\rNuclear magnetic spin quantum number I\r3.3\rInfluence of the magnetic field on the spin of nuclei, spin population\r3.4\rChemical shift (δ values), uses of TMS as reference\r3.5\rNuclear shielding and deshielding effects, equivalent and non equivalent protons\r3.6\rEffect of electronegativity of adjacent atoms on chemical shift values\r3.7\rSpin-spin splitting and spin-spin coupling\rUnit-4    Supramolecular Chemistry(05 Hrs)\r4.1\rIntroduction               Unnamed: 0

It also includes insights of photochemistry, pericyclic reaction and supramolecular\rchemistry.                      NaN

Photo Chemistry\r•\rPericyclic reactions(PCR)\r•\rDrug and synthetic dyes\r•\rOrganic Ploymers                      NaN

SARVAJANIK UNIVERSITY: B.Sc. CHEMISTRY\r\r\rProgram: B.Sc. (Sem-VI)Type: Theory\rSubject: DSC-12-Inorganic Chemistry-IV\rCredit: 04 (T) + 02 (P)Total learning hours: 60\rCourse description:\rThis course provides an overview of advance as well as fundamental topics in inorganic chemistry.\rThis course emphasise on various aspects of metal complexes.\rCourse comprises of information about role of inorganic components in biology, water technology,\rsome novel industrial inorganic compounds.\rStudent learning outcome:\rUpon completion of this course, students will:\r•\rHave systematic understanding bioinorganic chemistry\r•\rHave a deep knowledge regarding theoretical principles applied in inorganic qualitative\ranalysis\r•\rHave information regarding catalysis using organometallic compounds\r•\rBe able to understand various theories related to coordination compounds\r•\rGet exposure to various novel inorganic compounds of importance\r•\rCome to know about some fundamentals of inorganic reaction mechanism\r•\rGet an idea regarding water impurities, hardness and purification technique\r\rUnit-1 Bioinorganic Chemistry-I                                                                               (08 Hrs)\r1.1   Metal ions present in biological systems\r1.2   Essential and trace elements in biological systems with reference to Na+, K+,\rCa2+, Fe2+, P, Cu, V, Ni\r1.3   Excess and deficiency of some trace metals\r1.4 Toxicity of metal ions (Hg, Pb, Cd and As)\r1.5 Pt and Au complexes as drugs (examples only)\r1.6 Use of chelating agents in medicine\r\rUnit-2 Bioinorganic Chemistry-II                                                                            (08Hrs)\r2.1   Sodium / K-pump\r2.2   Introduction to metallo-enzymes, carbonic anhydrase and carboxypeptidase\r2.3   Iron and its application in bio-systems, Haemoglobin and myoglobin\r2.4   Role of cobalamin (vitamin-B12 coenzyme) in living systems\r2.5   Role of Ca2+ in blood clotting\r2.6   Nitrogen fixation\r\rUnit-3 Theoretical Principles of Qualitative Analysis                                             (08 Hrs)\r3.1   Basic principles involved in analysis of cations and anions\r3.2   Solubility products, common ion effect\r3.3   Principles involved in separation of cations into groups and choice of group\rreagents\r3.4   Interfering anions (fluoride, borate, oxalate and phosphate) and need to remove them\rafter Group II\r3.5   Methods of removal\r3.6   Analysis of insoluble substance               Unnamed: 0

SARVAJANIK UNIVERSITY: B.Sc. CHEMISTRY\r\r\r\rProgram: B.Sc. (Sem-VI)Type: Theory\rSubject:   SEC-4-Essential Skills of Computers\rCredit: 04 (T) + 02 (P)Total learning hours: 60\rCourse description:\rThis course introduce the fundamentals of computing devices and reinforce computer vocabulary,\rparticularly with respect to personal use of computer hardware and software, the Internet. Provide\rhands-on use of Office applications Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Introduce the database concept\rwith SQL  in Access\rStudent learning outcome:\rUpon completion of this course, students will able to:\r•\rUnderstand concepts of computer component\r•\rManage the documents, presentation and gain practical exposure on spreadsheet using office\rtool.\r•\rCreate and manage database using database tool.\r•\rUse SQL statements to store, modify and retrieve data from tables\r•\rgain skills & knowledge to browse and get updated worldwide information\r\rUnit-1   Introduction of Computers                                                                             (06Hrs)\r1.1   Evolution of computers ,Classification of Computers and components of computer\r1.2   Fundamentals of Computers\r1.2.1 Software\r1.2.2 Hardware\r1.2.3 Data and User\r1.3   Essential Computer Hardware\r1.3.1 Processing device\r1.3.2 Memory device-RAM & ROM\r1.3.3 Input and Output devices\r1.3.4 Storage device-Optical & Magnetic\r1.4. Operating System\rUnit-2   Operate the Computer System                                                                       (04Hrs)\r2.1. Start Menu\r2.1.1. Programs Documents Setting\r2.1.2. Taskbar toolbar2.1.3. Find and replace utility\r2.1.4. Help menu\r2.1.5. Shut Down, Restart\r2.2    Manage Computer\r2.2.1    Files & Folders\r2.2.2    Configuring Printers\r2.2.3    Installing Programs\r2.2.4    Display setting               Unnamed: 0

Provide\rhands-on use of Office applications Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Introduce the database concept\rwith SQL  in Access                      NaN
